title: @Riot, if someone says 'kill yourself', 'kys' or some other variation...
body:
...my understanding was that the second that game gets flagged (i.e. I report them), the automated system scans the chat log, finds the blacklisted words, and bans them regardless of context (if on the 1 out of 100 chance that it was not said with malicious intent the player is more than welcome to make a support ticket and overturn the decision).

So why after reporting dozens of players in the last few months have I only received only 1 notification that a player that have reported has been punished?

There is a serious issue with toxicity on this server and for some reason the most toxic of things are going almost completely unpunished (I've had death threats towards myself/teammates, homophobic and racial slurs, as well as people telling myself/teammates to kill themselves).

replies.body: Zero tolerance phrases, like hate speech and "kys" are punished pretty harshly. There are many instances where players complain of having received a 2-week ban without prior punishments because of this. I don't have an answer as to why some players weren't punished where others are; however, if a player is toxic, they'll eventually get hit with a punishment.

You seem to have fallen through some sort of wormhole and found yourself on the OCE forums.

On OCE, we seem to have one (or multiple) of the following issues (I'll wait for a Rioter to tell me which of these is correct):

1. The automated system is shit.
2. We have too many toxic players and not enough people reporting them.
3. Players are getting punished, but we're not getting the notification that someone we've reported has been punished leading players to believe that people actually aren't getting punished.

I honestly wouldn't be surprised if all 3 were true.

1. It's not going to be perfect, and never will be. Nothing can stop anyone from randomly being toxic in a game.
2. Yep. That's not a unique feeling for your server.
3. Yeah, you don't always get the notification that someone was punished. Some say you only get the notification when it's the triggering game, but who knows how that all works.

Point 1 is actually an issue on OCE though. The blacklist on this server is all but non-existent because it changes from server to server. From what I've been told, NA's blacklist is borderline overkill in how strict it is.
hate speech and phrases like kys are an immediate 14day ban regardless of context....yet days after reporting ht player they're still playing

Because Riot doesn't care about death threats or racism.

When I've asked them, I always get told "*This is not acceptable! This seriously goes against what the Summoner's Code stands for!* ***We won't do anything***"

Riot needs to purge these players from the game.

I've been playing since Season 2 but right now these scumbags make we want to quit.

I don't wanna keep following you around with this, but you claim that your concerns were never addressed, and when asked for you help in seeing them addressed, completely ignore it. It doesn't exactly lend credibility to your claims if you refuse to follow through on them. I thought perhaps it was something from a long time ago you didn't feel was worth following up anymore and it was just a bitter comment, but since you keep bringing it up that clearly isn't the case.

Death threats (serious or otherwise) are not a joke, and if you are aware of someone who got away with such a serious offence, or were told by support that they won't do anything, then I would like to know who (on both counts) so I can follow it up.

As has been mentioned by a few people here, the notification is notoriously unreliable, and nobody knows the exact conditions under which it's meant to appear. I expect it's probably kept intentionally ambiguous to prevent with hunting, but it would be nice if it was expanded.

Generally speaking, the conception that reports are ineffective for chat comes from a gross lack of feedback, rather than any actual ineffectiveness. There were some pretty big debates here on boards about the harsher punishments for chat like hate speech and suicide encouragement so clearly the impact was felt by the community.

All that said, if you *still* feel your reports aren't enough, you can also report directly to Player Support. That said, they can't and won't give you any information about another player's account, so you'll only ever get generic "thanks for your report" responses.
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

I feel for you, no one enjoys toxicity! And if i had a magic button that got rid of it all toxic players, i'd press it in a heart beat!
but there is a fine line between Justice and Vengeance.

Getting that notification doesn't help the justice system, its just personal gratification so you know _'that the guy who pissed you off before, now suffers! >:D'_, and that seems a hell of a lot more like vengeance than justice to me.

Justice is also about preventing the issue from happening in the first place.

So in the interest of Justice, I'm curious as to why you get so many death-threats/homophobia/racial-slurs/kys-messages in the first place? Because I've been playing since season 2 as well, and I get almost nothing like that.

Maybe its because:

1. I don't announce my sexuality during game. _(so how can they make fun of my sexuality?)_
2. I don't announce my race during game. _(so how can they make fun of my race?)_
3. I don't announce my name or location during game. _(so how can death threats be credible?)_
4. I don't actively give people a reason to dislike me. _(so why would they tell me to kys?)_

I just get on and play the game _(I'm not even very good)_, but funnily enough, I get very little toxicity aimed my way. 

A fire cant burn without fuel, if you don't want people to be toxic, don't give them fuel?

_________

The league community is incredibly diverse; we have very young kids and fully grown adults. We have christians, and muslims. Black people, white people. Gay people, straight people. Left wing supporters, right wing supporters. We probably even have someone who identifies as a flying magenta iguana that farts rainbows. And it's great that it is so diverse, _(it'd be boring if everyone was identical)._

But diversity also means that we are all different, we all have our own beliefs and interests, so you will **always** find someone who believes things a different way than you do, no amount of censorship or social justice can change that. The ONE thing we all have in common, is that we want to play League of Legends. So if you want to avoid unnecessary discomfort, focus on the single thing we **all** share an interest in.

So rather than waiting for vengeful notifications to hear toxic people have been banned _after_ they have been toxic. Focus on reducing the windows people have to be toxic in the first place. Then games are better for everyone.
If you are truly interested in having less toxicity in your games, 
then that would be my advice. ^^

e.g. If you don't want Braum to tell you to KYS, maybe don't make fun of his bad score? he's probably feeling shit enough already. So when you tell him he's bad, chances are, he will lash out at you.

e.g. No sane person is going to give you death threats because you accidentally fed their lane or stole their kill. Therefore, if you are receiving death threats, its probably because you are poking the bear in some way or another.


_______________________

Lots of people complain on the forums that they get all this homophobic and racial toxicity directed at them.  Well I have never disclosed my sexuality or race during a game of League _(why would I? It doesn't help push my lane.)_, and in all my 6+ years of playing league, I've never been the recipient of a homophobic or racist remark. 

Coincidence? I think not.

It's naive to think that just because it hasn't happened to you means it hasn't happened at all, but it is also true that many (dare I say most) of these claims are exaggerated in some way. It's part negativity bias, part sympathy theatre and part straight up frustration. A lot of these claims stem from some kernel of truth, but how accurately that truth is reflected depends a lot on the person making the claim.

I hardly ever see such extreme toxicity, but I *have* seen it, and sometimes there is no poking the bear, unless you count being in the wrong place at the wrong time as poking. Sometimes you feed a kill by accident, or steal a cs and someone will fly off the handle at you. It's rare, but it does happen, and it's unfair to put the blame on the victim. 

I'm not saying advertising your race/gender/sexuality in game is smart, because it's not, but that doesn't mean it's ok for people to target that, nor does it mean such advertisement is always present when people decide to get hateful.

Just yesterday someone called me gay (as a negative) because i told him the the special store includes champion cost if unowned...

Oh of course I don't assume that it doesn't happen just because I don't see much of it!
But after 6+ years of league playing, if there was as much blatant _hatred_ as everyone makes out to be, I'm sure i would have seen at least a little more than I have. 
Im sure there is a lot more than I have seen, but its funny how the insecure-sensitive people seem to come across a lot more 'intense hatred' than the thick-skinned people?

Yes its true that some people fly off the handle at nothing, but that is faaaaarrrrrr from being a common occurrence. 
It does happen yes, I've seen it myself too, _(in-fact not long ago I was playing a game, and our ADC got a kill during a fight, and our 2/14 Braum blew his top at her for stealing his kill...)_ but even that isn't 'homophobic' or 'racist'. and it certainly doesn't happen very often.

Im not saying the victim should be blamed at all! It doesn't matter what the girl was wearing, nothing justifies rape!
However, if you dress like a prostitute and get wasted at 2:00 in the morning in an alleyway, your chances unfortunately, do go up. _(its still not your fault, and it can still happen to anyone, but it is within your power to avoid putting yourself in dangerous situations.)_
Same with league, you're always at risk of getting toxicity even if you're as polite as the Queen, but if you start a game with _"Hi guys I voted yes to gay marriage because gay love is more pure than straight love!"_ your chances of copping a homophobic remark, go up. You still don't deserve abuse, but you could have taken measures to at least reduce the chances. 


_______________

Thats the weirdest reason for someone to call you gay that I've ever heard? xD 
But even that isn't homophobic. Its unpleasant for sure, but if they don't know your sexuality, its hardly targeted homophobia.

Over the years the word 'gay' has developed a tertiary use as a word for something thats 'just a little bit shit'. gay people may not like this new use of the word, but that is a way it is used. It isn't a derogatory thing against gay people, its just another meaning the word has developed over time. In fact, originally it wasn't even used to describe homosexuality either, that too is just a new meaning people have tacked onto the word. So It's ironic that gay people get all pissy when you use the word to describe something 'a little bit shit', when they themselves are using the word in a way it wasn't originally meant either.

_"He skipped down the street as carefree and **gay** as a child with a lollypop."_

_"He came out of the room very relieved, telling his parents he was **gay** had been difficult, but they had accepted it."_

_"Splat! 'Awww **gay**...' came the cry, blown by the wind across the paddock, Lenny s%%%%%%ed, Harry had obviously dropped his pie."_

All are completely different and unrelated meanings of the word.
Perhaps originally the meanings stemmed from each other. 'Gay' (happy) probably started to be used in conjunction with two men finding happiness, turning into 'Gay' (homosexual). 'Gay' (homosexual) then probably then started being used as term for something that turned out not quite as expected. And now by further development we have 'Gay' (a little bit shit), which has absolutely no connection to the previous meanings of the word, and is just an expressive slang term.

Originally it probably was a little derogatory, but language is a living thing, and now the new use is so ingrained in everyday language, that it has no connection to the other uses of the word.

E.g. Similarly, 'Thursday' is just a development of 'Thor's Day'. Yet Christians still use the word Thursday, because its new meaning as just 'the 4th day of the week' has nothing at all to do with the Norse God of Thunder. Thats just how language works.

Clearly this needs to be said *yet again*, the IFS *does not* notify *every* player who contributed a report to a punished player. It will notify only the most recent (specifically, those in the game that triggers the punishment, maybe even only one of those), and only those who reported for the behaviour (or, rather, category) that got punished.

Just because you don't receive a notification for it doesn't mean the player wasn't punished.

That's the problem though. If someone tells me to 'kill myself' and I report them, they should be banned within minutes. If the automated system was doing its job, I should be the most recent person to have reported them and I should have been the one to trigger the automated chat log check for the match.

> If the automated system was doing its job, I should be the most recent person to have reported them

Based on the assumption that you would have been *the only* 1 of 4-9 players to have reported the person in any given match. Just because you have reported a player for that kind of behaviour doesn't necessarily mean you are the *most recent* report, and it doesn't mean you are the most recent report prior to the punishment. For all you know, a punishment was implemented prior to you submitting your report. It *is* possible for players to join another game between the time it takes for such a report to go through, and if we're going on your logic of "they should be banned within minutes" (as I understand it, Riot stated that the IFS strives to act within 15 minutes, not necessarily within only a few), it's (theoretically) possible that the time it takes for you to submit the report is enough for someone else to have submitted theirs, the system to perform a review and issue a punishment.

"kill yourself" Isn't a zero tolerance phrase - It used to be pretty high up but after a bunch of people got banned for telling people to suicide to towers in ARAM Riot took it off the "banned if you say it twice in a game" list.

I actually tested the theory of IFS, with a bunch of friends who were not on my friend list, on purpose, and told them to kill themselves i was hit with a 14 dayer like 2 mins after the game ended, None of the 4 received the IFS notification on an account that had NEVER been banned prior

IFS doesn't tell people all the time, but sure enough KYS users get punished

Just as a note, if you've used a brand new account, you can't actually count the test you did.

IFS punishes new accounts harder because they don't have a history of "good" behaviour.
